tasks.title: Project Structure and Environment Setup
tasks.description: Initialize the directory structure and environment variables for the Media Empire stack.
tasks.details: Create the root project directory. Inside, create subdirectories: ./config, ./media (with subfolders movies, tv), and ./downloads (with subfolders torrents, usenet). Create a .env file to store PUID, PGID, and TZ to ensure consistent permissions across containers.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify directory existence using 'ls -R' and ensure .env file is readable by the docker user.

subtasks.title: Create Root and Config Directories
subtasks.description: Initialize the main project folder and the configuration storage directory.
subtasks.details: Execute 'mkdir -p media-empire/config' to establish the base structure for persistent application data.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'ls -d media-empire/config' to confirm directory existence.

subtasks.title: Initialize Media Library Subfolders
subtasks.description: Create the hierarchical structure for storing movies and television shows. [Updated: 1/6/2026]
subtasks.details:
Execute 'mkdir -p media-empire/media/movies media-empire/media/tv' to prepare the library for media management services.
<info added on 2026-01-06T08:23:52.253Z>
The media/movies and media/tv directories have been successfully created.
</info added on 2026-01-06T08:23:52.253Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'ls -R media-empire/media' to verify both subdirectories are present.

subtasks.title: Initialize Download Management Subfolders
subtasks.description: Create dedicated directories for torrent and usenet download clients.
subtasks.details: Execute 'mkdir -p media-empire/downloads/torrents media-empire/downloads/usenet' to separate incoming traffic types.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'ls -R media-empire/downloads' to verify the torrents and usenet folders.

subtasks.title: Configure Environment Variables File
subtasks.description: Create a .env file containing the PUID, PGID, and Timezone variables. [Updated: 1/6/2026]
subtasks.details:
Create a file named '.env' in the root directory. Populate it with PUID=$(id -u), PGID=$(id -g), and TZ=UTC (or local timezone).
<info added on 2026-01-06T08:24:01.982Z>
The .env file has been successfully created and verified to contain the correct PUID, PGID, and TZ variables.
</info added on 2026-01-06T08:24:01.982Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'cat .env' to ensure variables are correctly formatted and saved.

subtasks.title: Set Filesystem Permissions
subtasks.description: Apply ownership and permission rules to ensure Docker containers can read/write to the directories.
subtasks.details:
Run 'chown -R $USER:$USER media-empire' and 'chmod -R 775 media-empire' to prevent permission denied errors during container runtime.
<info added on 2026-01-06T08:24:11.871Z>
Permission update partially successful: media and downloads directories are correctly set, but the ./config directory remains root-owned and requires elevated privileges to modify.
</info added on 2026-01-06T08:24:11.871Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'ls -la media-empire' to verify that the current user owns the directories and write bits are set.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Break down into directory creation with permission handling and .env variable definition for PUID/PGID.

tasks.title: Docker Network and Base Compose Configuration
tasks.description: Define the Docker Compose version and create a dedicated bridge network for service communication.
tasks.details: Create a docker-compose.yml file. Define a custom bridge network named 'media-network'. Set up the global volume mappings for ./config, ./media, and ./downloads to be used by subsequent service definitions.
tasks.testStrategy: Run 'docker network inspect media-network' after a partial up to confirm network creation.

subtasks.title: Initialize docker-compose.yml file
subtasks.description: Create the base docker-compose.yml file in the project root directory.
subtasks.details: Create a new file named docker-compose.yml and specify the Docker Compose version (e.g., '3.8') at the top of the file.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify file existence using 'ls docker-compose.yml' and validate syntax with 'docker-compose config'.

subtasks.title: Define Custom Bridge Network
subtasks.description: Configure a dedicated bridge network for internal container communication. [Updated: 1/6/2026]
subtasks.details:
Add a top-level 'networks' section to the compose file and define 'media-network' with the driver set to 'bridge'.
<info added on 2026-01-06T08:25:26.865Z>
The media-network bridge has been successfully defined in the networks section of the docker-compose.yml file.
</info added on 2026-01-06T08:25:26.865Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'docker-compose up --no-start' followed by 'docker network ls' to confirm 'media-network' exists.

subtasks.title: Configure Global Volume Mappings
subtasks.description: Define the standard volume paths for configuration, media, and downloads.
subtasks.details: Map local directories ./config, ./media, and ./downloads to the compose environment to ensure data persistence across all services.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check the 'volumes' section of the YAML file for correct path syntax and mapping.

subtasks.title: Implement Environment Variable Integration
subtasks.description: Link the .env file variables to the base compose configuration.
subtasks.details: Ensure the compose file is prepared to use ${PUID}, ${PGID}, and ${TZ} variables defined in the Task 1 environment setup.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'docker-compose config' to verify that environment variables are correctly interpolated into the configuration.

subtasks.title: Validate Network and Volume Schema
subtasks.description: Perform a final validation of the network and volume definitions within the YAML structure. [Updated: 1/6/2026]
subtasks.details:
Review the indentation and structure of the networks and volumes blocks to ensure they follow the Docker Compose specification.
<info added on 2026-01-06T08:25:29.107Z>
The configuration has been successfully validated using the docker compose config command to ensure the YAML structure, networks, and volumes adhere to the Docker Compose specification.
</info added on 2026-01-06T08:25:29.107Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute 'docker-compose config -q' to ensure there are no schema errors in the final file.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Detail the creation of the docker-compose.yml skeleton and the definition of the custom bridge network.

tasks.title: Deploy Download Clients (SABnzbd & qBittorrent)

tasks.details: Add SABnzbd (port 8085) and qBittorrent (port 8080) to docker-compose.yml. Map ./downloads/usenet to SABnzbd and ./downloads/torrents to qBittorrent. Ensure they use the 'media-network'.

subtasks.title: Configure SABnzbd Service in Docker Compose
subtasks.description: Add the SABnzbd container definition to the docker-compose.yml file. [Updated: 1/6/2026]
subtasks.details:
Define the sabnzbd service using the linuxserver/sabnzbd image. Map host port 8085 to container port 8080. Assign it to the 'media-network'.
<info added on 2026-01-06T08:31:21.727Z>
Map the host directory ./downloads/usenet to the container to ensure downloads are stored correctly. Access the web UI at localhost:8085 to verify the service is running.
</info added on 2026-01-06T08:31:21.727Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'docker-compose up -d' and check if the container starts without errors.

subtasks.title: Configure qBittorrent Service in Docker Compose
subtasks.description: Add the qBittorrent container definition to the docker-compose.yml file. [Updated: 1/6/2026]
subtasks.details:
Define the qbittorrent service using the linuxserver/qbittorrent image. Map host port 8080 to container port 8080. Assign it to the 'media-network'.

subtasks.title: Set Up Persistent Volume Mounts
subtasks.description: Configure the local directory mappings for both download clients. [Updated: 1/6/2026]
subtasks.details:
Map ./downloads/usenet to /downloads in SABnzbd and ./downloads/torrents to /downloads in qBittorrent. Ensure ./config paths are also mapped for persistence.
<info added on 2026-01-06T08:31:24.915Z>
Map the ./media directory to the containers to allow the download clients to move or hardlink completed files to the appropriate media folders.
</info added on 2026-01-06T08:31:24.915Z>

subtasks.title: Verify Web UI Accessibility
subtasks.description: Ensure the web interfaces for both clients are reachable via the specified ports.
subtasks.details: Navigate to http://localhost:8085 for SABnzbd and http://localhost:8080 for qBittorrent to confirm the services are responding.
subtasks.testStrategy: Confirm the login or setup wizard screen appears for both applications in a web browser.

subtasks.title: Validate Download Path Permissions
subtasks.description: Ensure the containers have the necessary read/write permissions for the download folders. [Updated: 1/6/2026]
subtasks.details:
Check the PUID and PGID environment variables in docker-compose to ensure they match the host user owning the ./downloads directory.
<info added on 2026-01-06T08:31:27.037Z>
Permissions have been successfully configured by setting the PUID and PGID environment variables in the docker-compose file to match the host user.
</info added on 2026-01-06T08:31:27.037Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Initiate a test download in each client and verify the file is successfully written to the host filesystem.

tasks.title: Deploy Indexer Manager (Prowlarr)

tasks.details: Add Prowlarr (port 9696) to docker-compose.yml. Configure it to store data in ./config/prowlarr. This service will act as the sync point for Radarr and Sonarr indexers.
tasks.testStrategy: Access localhost:9696 and verify that a test indexer (e.g., 1337x) can be added.

subtasks.title: Define Prowlarr Service in Docker Compose
subtasks.description: Add the Prowlarr service definition to the existing docker-compose.yml file. [Updated: 1/6/2026]
subtasks.details:
Use image linuxserver/prowlarr:latest, map port 9696:9696, and set the timezone environment variable.
<info added on 2026-01-06T08:32:27.651Z>
Map the configuration data to the local directory ./config/prowlarr to ensure persistent storage for the service.
</info added on 2026-01-06T08:32:27.651Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'docker-compose config' to ensure the YAML syntax is valid for the new service.

subtasks.title: Configure Persistent Volume Mapping
subtasks.description: Set up the local directory structure for Prowlarr configuration data.
subtasks.details: Map the host directory ./config/prowlarr to /config inside the container to ensure settings persist across restarts.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the ./config/prowlarr directory is created on the host after the container starts.

subtasks.title: Initialize Prowlarr Container
subtasks.description: Pull the image and start the Prowlarr service using Docker Compose.
subtasks.details: Execute 'docker-compose up -d prowlarr' and monitor logs to ensure the application initializes without errors.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check 'docker-compose logs prowlarr' for the 'Prowlarr is ready' message.

subtasks.title: Configure Initial Indexer and Proxy Settings
subtasks.description: Access the Web UI and set up a test indexer to verify external connectivity.

subtasks.testStrategy: Confirm the 'Test' button returns a green checkmark for the added indexer.

subtasks.details: Add Radarr and Sonarr as 'Applications' in Prowlarr settings using their internal Docker network hostnames and API keys.

tasks.title: Deploy Media Management (Radarr & Sonarr)
tasks.description: Configure Radarr for movies and Sonarr for TV shows.
tasks.details: Add Radarr (7878) and Sonarr (8989) to docker-compose.yml. Map ./media/movies to Radarr and ./media/tv to Sonarr. Connect both to Prowlarr and the download clients via internal Docker DNS.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify Radarr/Sonarr can communicate with Prowlarr and see the download clients in their 'Download Clients' settings.

subtasks.title: Configure Radarr Service in Docker Compose
subtasks.description: Add the Radarr service definition to the docker-compose.yml file.
subtasks.details: Define the Radarr container using the linuxserver/radarr image. Map port 7878, set the PUID/PGID, and mount the volumes for ./config/radarr and ./media/movies.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'docker-compose up -d radarr' and verify the UI is accessible at localhost:7878.

subtasks.title: Configure Sonarr Service in Docker Compose
subtasks.description: Add the Sonarr service definition to the docker-compose.yml file.
subtasks.details: Define the Sonarr container using the linuxserver/sonarr image. Map port 8989, set environment variables, and mount volumes for ./config/sonarr and ./media/tv.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'docker-compose up -d sonarr' and verify the UI is accessible at localhost:8989.

subtasks.title: Integrate Radarr and Sonarr with Prowlarr
subtasks.description: Sync indexers from Prowlarr to both Radarr and Sonarr using API keys.

subtasks.title: Link Download Clients to Radarr
subtasks.description: Connect Radarr to qBittorrent and SABnzbd for movie downloads.

subtasks.testStrategy: Use the 'Test' button in Radarr's Download Client settings to confirm a successful connection.

subtasks.title: Link Download Clients to Sonarr
subtasks.description: Connect Sonarr to qBittorrent and SABnzbd for TV show downloads.

subtasks.testStrategy: Use the 'Test' button in Sonarr's Download Client settings to confirm a successful connection.

tasks.title: Deploy Jellyfin Media Server

tasks.testStrategy: Access localhost:8096, complete the setup wizard, and verify that the library scan detects files in ./media.

subtasks.testStrategy: Execute 'jellyfin-ffmpeg -drivers' inside the container to verify GPU driver visibility.

subtasks.title: Set Environment Variables and User Permissions
subtasks.description: Configure PUID and PGID to ensure the container has correct file system permissions.
subtasks.details: Add PUID and PGID environment variables matching the host user. Set JELLYFIN_PublishedServerUrl if necessary for remote access discovery.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check container logs to ensure no 'Permission Denied' errors appear during startup.

subtasks.title: Initialize Jellyfin Setup Wizard and Library Scan
